pullRequest.body:
Also use it to golf
`Subgroup.mem_closure_singleton_iff_existsUnique_zpow`.


---

### PR summary [18fb5d61a1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16937/commits/18fb5d61a1ada5eec853f0fbb6b2e7e5122b4324)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ zpow_right_strictAnti`
`+ zsmul_strictMono_left`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
```

ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10964774063/job/30449125651)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10964774063/job/30449126245)

Thanks!

maintainer merge

Thanks!

maintainer merge
I think then we should also have `zpow_lt_one'` above. The `to_additive` name might have to be `zsmul_neg'` due to the clash with `zsmul` of `neg` powers.
It seems it would be useful in your proof without to rely on `one_lt_inv'` (?)
There are 4 natural lemmas here, we have 1 of them. Possibly, we should have all 4, but IMHO this is out of scope of this PR.

```suggestion
@[to_additive zsmul_left_strictAnti]
```
Oh, I guess this matches the name above. @YaelDillies, any thoughts on which name is right?
Yes, I copied the name from above.
Your name is better. The name above is vestigial

```suggestion
```

Now that you proved the above lemma, can you generalise this to
```suggestion
 lemma zpow_right_inj (ha : a != 1) {m n : â„¤} : a ^ m = a ^ n â†” m = n :=
```
No, because we don't assume `LinearOrder` here.
Do you have a use case for the non-linear order version?

No, but I prefer to postpone this until I [introduce `NoRootsOfUnity`](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/116395-maths/topic/Multiplicative.20version.20of.20NoZeroSMulDivisors.3F), because this is the right typeclass assumption for the lemma with `ne` assumption.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Order/Group): add `zpow_right_strictAnti`
